column4: i think 32bit Ubuntu "should" be able to see up to 3.2GB memory (not sure though) -- AMD64 will also work for Intel 64bit CPUs as well.
faileas,  so it will not mess with anything but my time TRYING to use the AMD64 iso ?
ZykoticK9, I got   bash: lscpu: command not found
faileas, Thank you ... nothing ventured, nothing gained ... I just did not want to fry my primary box !!
perhaps lscpu is only on 9.10 - what version you using?
on older versions you can use "cat /proc/cpuinfo" but it doesn't have such a nice clean answer to "is my cpu 64 bit"
not the same thing!  you'd have to google the CPU name to verify that it is 64bit
model name : Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU     E4500  @ 2.20GHz
i'm "pretty" sure all the Core2Duo's are infact 64 bit
yup it's 64bit (so AMD64 would work for ya) http://www.intel.com/products/processor/core2duo/specifications.htm?iid=prod_core2duo+tab_spec
THANK YOU ... I will download the AMD64.iso .. and install tomorrow night !!
